etymology.description: 髟(髟) (biāo, "hair") + phonetic: 然(然) (rán) = hair-like appearance -> beard
etymology.interpretation: The character 髯(rán, "beard") utilizes the semantic component 髟(髟) representing hair, combined with the phonetic component 然(然) to suggest a word related to hair, specifically a beard.

examples.chinese: 他留着长髯(他留著長髯)。
老者披上长衫(老者披上長衫)，露出精致的髯(露出精緻的髯)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎo zhě pī shàng cháng shān, lùchū jīngzhì de rán.
examples.english: The old man dons a long robe, revealing his exquisite beard.
